ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Humourous note:  Verant defies laws of physics - ag ain!
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@pinkpig.com] Sent: Monday, May 15, 2000 5:25 PM To: eqbards@egroups.com Subject: Re: [eqbards] Humourous note:
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Monday, May 15, 2000 5:25 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Humourous note: Verant defies laws of physics -
again!


At 12:45 PM 5/17/00 -0500, you wrote:

> >Anyway - it started out as an argument about why the water flowed from
the
> >ocean into the lake, instead of backwards - until we remembered that
> >there's some NPC that says the lake is salty...
>
>
>I understood that the pool just inside the zone was a spring, and that
water
>flowed from it both to the sea and to the lake. Does the water in the creek
>to the sea really flow up?
>
>Tszaaz E'Taurguin, 30, Soi Disant Gentry, Povar

Okay - it does appear that I was wrong - but if you follow that riverbed,
it does exhibit some oddities.

In any case, if the lake is so salty - where is the water coming from?

Talies
